wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the analyzer-web financial reconciliation platform. Explain its purpose as a full-stack application for matching internal and external financial transactions, maintaining audit trails, and enabling data-driven reconciliation decisions. Describe the high-level architecture using Next.js 14 App Router, Prisma ORM, and NextAuth.js, emphasizing the integration between frontend components and backend API routes. Document the core workflows: user authentication, Excel transaction import, dual-pane reconciliation interface, match group creation, and snapshot versioning. Include conceptual overviews for beginners on how the system supports role-based access control (Admin, Manager, Analyst, Auditor) and cryptographic audit logging via AuditService. Provide technical details for experienced developers on JWT session management, database schema design with 9 core entities, and service-layer patterns. Use practical examples from the codebase such as the ReconcileProApp component orchestrating FileSheetSelector and DualPaneTransactionView. Illustrate key concepts with diagrams showing data flow from Excel upload to database persistence via /api/transactions/import and Prisma. Address common issues like session timeout handling and failed login lockout mechanisms. Highlight performance considerations including efficient transaction table rendering and secure API endpoint protection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the authentication system in the analyzer-web application. Explain the integration of NextAuth.js with custom database-backed authentication, including credential-based login and OAuth flows. Detail the implementation in /app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts where NextAuth is initialized with custom authOptions from lib/auth.ts. Document the enhanced security features: progressive account locking after 5 failed attempts, 15-minute lockout duration, and automatic unlock. Describe the session management system including device session tracking, session token generation, and IP address logging. Explain the role-based access control implementation where UserRole is persisted in JWT tokens, session objects, and database records. Document the audit logging of authentication events (successful/failed login, logout) with change summaries. Include configuration requirements such as NEXTAUTH_SECRET and NEXTAUTH_URL environment variables, referencing the troubleshooting guide in PRODUCTION_AUTH_FIX.md. Provide examples of secure credential validation, password hashing with bcrypt (cost factor 12), and session expiration (24 hours). Address common deployment issues and their solutions, including secret management and URL configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: ReconcileProApp Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the ReconcileProApp component, the main orchestrator of the analyzer-web application. Explain its role as the central container that manages global state including transactions, matches, audit logs, user roles, and reconciliation snapshots. Document how it integrates key UI components such as TransactionImportWorkspace, DualPaneTransactionView, MatchControls, HistoryPanel, and AdminDashboard based on the current view mode. Detail the authentication integration using NextAuth's useSession hook and role-based permission system that controls feature access. Describe the state persistence mechanism using localStorage with the STORAGE_KEY constant and the undo/redo functionality implemented through history and future stacks. Explain the idle timeout feature that automatically logs out inactive users after IDLE_TIMEOUT_MS. Cover the data loading workflow that fetches transaction sheets from the /api/transactions/sheets endpoint and processes them into internal transaction format with proper side assignment (Left/Right). Document the match execution logic that validates transaction amounts using DR/CR reconciliation flags and creates immutable match groups. Include examples of how audit logging is implemented through the addAuditLog function and how system snapshots are created for versioning. Address common issues such as state synchronization between components, handling of closed/locked periods, and separation of duties in approval workflows. Provide performance optimization tips including selective re-renders and efficient state updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the UserService component of the analyzer-web application. Thoroughly explain its implementation details, including user creation with password hashing (bcrypt), retrieval by email or ID, and management of user roles and status. Document the invocation relationship with API routes such as /api/admin/users and how it integrates with the AdminDashboard UI. Detail the domain model including User, UserWithoutPassword, CreateUserInput, and UpdateUserInput interfaces. Explain security features like failed login tracking, account locking, and MFA readiness. Include concrete examples from the codebase such as the createUser method that hashes passwords and generates avatars, and the verifyPassword method used during authentication. Address common issues like email case sensitivity, handling of soft-deleted users, and race conditions during login attempts. Provide performance optimization tips for querying large user sets and indexing strategies on email and role fields. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers implementing custom user workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Import
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the transaction import feature. Explain the implementation of the file upload mechanism in TransactionImporter.tsx, including drag-and-drop and browse functionality. Document the parsing logic in excel-import.ts that uses the xlsx library to detect columns (date, amount, description, reference, type) using flexible naming patterns. Detail how the API endpoint at /api/transactions/import handles multipart form data, validates file types (.xlsx, .xls), and returns structured transaction sets. Describe the TransactionImportWorkspace component that orchestrates the upload and selection workflow. Include examples from TRANSACTION_IMPORT_GUIDE.md showing request/response formats, supported Excel structures, and error handling. Address common issues like malformed files, missing required columns, and type inference logic. Provide performance tips for handling large files up to 10MB and memory-efficient parsing strategies. Explain integration with NextAuth for session validation and Tailwind CSS for responsive UI rendering.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the User entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including id, email, name, role, status, avatar, security tracking fields (lastLogin, failedLoginAttempts, lockedUntil), and timestamps. Explain the relationship between the Prisma schema and TypeScript interface, noting how role is stored as a String in the database but represented as UserRole enum in TypeScript. Document the one-to-many relationships with Transaction, MatchGroup, AuditLog, DeviceSession, SystemSnapshot, FileImport, and RoleRequest. Include information about unique constraints on email, indexes on role, and the soft-delete pattern with status field. Reference the default admin user creation process and password management scripts in LOGIN_CREDENTIALS.md. Provide examples of common queries such as finding users by role or status, and explain how user data is used throughout the application for access control and audit logging.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the authentication endpoints at /api/auth/[...nextauth]. Document the POST method for login/logout operations and GET method for session retrieval. Detail how NextAuth.js handles JWT token management, session persistence, and CSRF protection automatically. Explain the integration with lib/auth.ts for custom authentication options and api-security.ts for enhanced security features like rate limiting and device fingerprinting. Include request/response schemas: for login, document expected credentials format and success response with session token; for logout, document empty response with 200 status. Describe error handling for invalid credentials (401 Unauthorized) and forbidden access (403 Forbidden). Provide examples using fetch or axios to authenticate from frontend components like Login page. Address security considerations including secure cookie settings, HTTPS enforcement, and protection against brute force attacks via the built-in rate limiting in api-security.ts. Include debugging tips such as checking NextAuth debug logs and verifying environment variables for OAuth providers.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the /api/admin/users endpoint in the analyzer-web application. Document the GET method that retrieves all users with fields id, name, email, role, avatar, and status, requiring 'manage_users' permission and admin authentication via validateRequest. Detail the POST method for creating new users, including request body parameters (name, email, role, status, password), default password assignment ('Welcome123!'), automatic avatar generation from initials, and password hashing using bcryptjs. Explain the 400 error for missing required fields, 500 error for database issues or duplicate emails, and 401/403 for authentication failures. Include example requests with proper Authorization headers and demonstrate the integration with Prisma ORM for database operations. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like duplicate email errors, password hashing failures, and session validation problems. Address security considerations including password hashing, role-based access control, and data sanitization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the technology stack of the analyzer-web application. Explain the role of each framework and library: Next.js 14 for server-side rendering and API routes, Prisma ORM for type-safe database access, NextAuth.js for authentication flows, Tailwind CSS for utility-first styling, and xlsx for Excel parsing. Detail configuration options in next.config.mjs including modular imports and asset optimization, and explain how Tailwind classes are used across components like TransactionTable and MatchControls. Document the integration between TypeScript for type safety, Prisma schema for data modeling, and custom types in lib/types.ts. Include practical examples such as how the excel-import.ts utility uses xlsx to parse uploaded files, or how env-validation.ts ensures runtime environment correctness. Explain relationships between toolsâ€”e.g., how NextAuth callbacks interact with Prisma client via the auth.ts adapter. Address common issues like Tailwind class purging in production builds (referencing TAILWIND_TROUBLESHOOTING.md) and provide performance optimization tips such as code splitting and lazy loading of heavy components. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers on version compatibility and dependency management.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Security
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the API security framework in the analyzer-web application. Explain the implementation of security headers in middleware.ts including X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Referrer-Policy, and HSTS enforcement in production. Document the Content Security Policy (CSP) configuration tailored for banking environments with specific directives for script, style, font, image, and connect sources. Describe the Permissions-Policy implementation restricting camera, microphone, and geolocation access. Detail the rate limiting and input validation mechanisms in lib/api-security.ts, including request sanitization and injection prevention. Explain how role-based access control is enforced at the API route level, particularly in /app/api/admin/users/route.ts where admin privileges are required. Document the authentication middleware configuration that protects routes while allowing public access to login and API authentication endpoints. Include examples of secure error handling that prevents information leakage and proper session validation. Address production security considerations such as secret management, secure cookie configuration, and protection against common web vulnerabilities (CSRF, XSS, SQL injection).

wiki_catalogs.name: DualPaneTransactionView Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the DualPaneTransactionView component that enables side-by-side comparison of internal (GL) and external (Statement) financial transactions. Explain its purpose in facilitating the reconciliation process by visually presenting two distinct transaction sets with independent selection capabilities. Document the component's props interface that accepts structured GL and statement transaction data with CR/DR categorization. Describe the UI layout implementation using a CSS grid with two equal columns, each containing a transaction list with header statistics and selection indicators. Detail the TransactionCard sub-component that displays individual transactions with type-specific coloring (INT CR, INT DR, EXT DR, EXT CR) and checkbox-based selection. Explain the selection state management using React hooks (selectedGLIds, selectedStatementIds) and the toggle selection handlers. Cover the financial calculation functions including formatCurrency for monetary values and calculateTotal for summing transaction amounts. Document the responsive design considerations and accessibility features such as keyboard navigation support. Include implementation details of the floating match button that appears when transactions are selected in both panes, with console logging of selected items. Address common issues such as handling empty transaction lists, maintaining selection state during data updates, and performance optimization for large transaction sets. Provide guidance on integrating this component with the parent ReconcileProApp and connecting it to the actual matching logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Match Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the MatchService component responsible for transaction reconciliation in the analyzer-web platform. Thoroughly explain implementation details of the createMatch method, which enforces strict zero-difference matching between left and right transaction sets using atomic database transactions. Document the invocation relationship from UI components like MatchControls and DualPaneTransactionView, and how match creation triggers updates to transaction statuses. Detail the domain model including MatchGroup, CreateMatchInput, and the use of JSON.stringify for storing transaction ID arrays. Explain business rules such as the prohibition of non-zero differences and automatic status updates to MATCHED. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how executeInTransaction ensures data consistency during match creation and unmatch operations. Address common issues like handling concurrent matches on the same transactions, validation of input transaction IDs, and performance considerations when processing large match groups. Discuss planned enhancements including batch operations, auto-suggest algorithms, and separation of duties validation. Provide optimization tips for indexing matchGroup and transaction tables and handling high-volume reconciliation sessions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dual-Pane Reconciliation Interface
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the dual-pane reconciliation interface in DualPaneTransactionView.tsx. Explain the layout design that separates GL (Internal) transactions on the left and Statement (External) transactions on the right, with color-coded indicators (blue/indigo for INT CR/DR, green/emerald for EXT DR/CR). Document the use of TransactionTable components for rendering scrollable, selectable transaction lists with checkboxes and virtualized rendering for performance. Describe how MatchControls enables users to select transactions from both panes and initiate matching workflows. Include usage patterns such as filtering, selection tracking, and floating match button behavior. Reference TRANSACTION_IMPORT_GUIDE.md for transaction type definitions and UI styling guidelines. Address common issues like incorrect transaction categorization, selection state management, and responsiveness on mobile devices. Provide best practices for optimizing rendering performance with large datasets and ensuring accessibility compliance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Transaction entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including the seven Excel columns (sn, date, description, amount, glRefNo, aging, recon), legacy compatibility fields (reference, side, status, type), relationship fields (matchId, importedById, fileImportId, sheetImportId), and metadata fields (isDeleted, archivedAt, contentHash). Explain how transactions are categorized by type (int cr, int dr, ext cr, ext dr) based on the RECON column and assigned to sides (LEFT/RIGHT) for dual-pane display. Document the foreign key relationships with MatchGroup, User, FileImport, and SheetImport. Include information about indexes on date, side, status, contentHash, fileImportId, and sheetImportId for query performance. Reference the transaction import process documented in DATABASE_PERSISTENCE.md and TRANSACTION_IMPORT_GUIDE.md, explaining how transactions are parsed from Excel sheets and saved to the database. Provide examples of common queries such as retrieving transactions by type, date range, or import source.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the user management endpoints under /api/admin/users. Document all HTTP methods: GET for retrieving user lists with pagination and filtering, POST for creating new users (excluding passwords which are set via email link), PATCH for updating user roles and status (including deactivation), and DELETE for soft-deleting users. Detail request/response schemas including required fields like name, email, role, and optional fields. Explain authentication requirements using validateRequest from api-security.ts with ADMIN-level permissions. Describe response formats: 200 OK for successful retrievals, 201 Created for new user creation, 400 Bad Request for validation errors, and 403 Forbidden for insufficient permissions. Include examples of fetching all users and updating a user's role from ANALYST to MANAGER. Address security considerations such as audit logging via AuditService on every change, protection against privilege escalation, and input sanitization. Provide client implementation guidelines for AdminDashboard component integration and performance optimization tips like caching user lists and batching updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Import API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the /api/transactions/import endpoint that handles Excel file uploads for financial transaction reconciliation. Document the POST method that accepts multipart/form-data with 'file' (Excel file) and optional 'override' boolean parameters. Explain the authentication flow using NextAuth.js session validation, file type validation (.xlsx, .xls), and file hash generation for duplicate detection using generateFileHash. Detail the duplicate handling logic: returning 409 Conflict with existing import details when duplicate is found unless override=true triggers deletion of existing data. Describe the parsing workflow using parseExcelFile to extract transaction sets with GL and statement transactions, database persistence via Prisma with FileImport and SheetImport records, and transaction categorization by side (LEFT/RIGHT) and type. Include the complete response schema with success, message, and data containing fileImportId, fileName, sheetCount, and transactionSets. Document error handling for 400 (invalid file, no valid sheets), 401 (unauthorized), and 500 (server errors), with specific guidance on the 'dept' cell validation requirement in A1:D10. Provide client implementation examples showing proper FormData construction and header configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on setting up the analyzer-web development environment. Provide step-by-step installation instructions including cloning the repository, installing dependencies with npm install, configuring environment variables (referencing env-validation.ts), and initializing the SQLite database via Prisma migrations. Include basic usage examples such as starting the dev server with 'npm run dev', accessing the login page at /login, and using the provided seed credentials (admin@analyzerweb.com / password123). Document the Docker-based development setup using Dockerfile.dev and docker-compose.yml for containerized execution. Explain how to run database seeding with 'npx prisma db seed' and verify data population. Guide users through navigating core features: logging in, importing an Excel file via TransactionImportWorkspace, reconciling transactions in DualPaneTransactionView, and viewing audit logs. Address common setup issues such as missing .env configuration, Prisma migration errors, and Docker networking problems. Provide troubleshooting guidance from PRODUCTION_TROUBLESHOOTING.md and performance considerations for local development versus production deployment.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for all backend endpoints in the analyzer-web application. For each endpoint, document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, authentication requirements, and error codes. Start with /api/admin/users for user management (GET all users, POST create, PATCH update, DELETE deactivate) requiring admin role. Document /api/transactions/import for Excel file uploads via multipart form data, including file validation, parsing with xlsx library, and transaction creation. Describe /api/sync/folders for folder synchronization operations and /api/transactions/sheets for retrieving available sheets from uploaded files. Include detailed request examples with proper headers (Authorization Bearer token) and payload structures. Document response formats including success (200, 201) and error states (400, 401, 403, 404, 500) with consistent error response bodies. Explain the integration between API routes and service layer components, showing how requests are processed through validation, business logic, and data persistence. Address rate limiting policies, request size limits for file uploads, and timeout considerations. Provide client implementation guidelines for handling authentication tokens and refreshing sessions.

wiki_catalogs.name: TransactionTable Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the TransactionTable component that displays financial transactions in a sortable, filterable tabular format. Explain its role in the reconciliation workflow as the primary interface for viewing and selecting transactions for matching. Document the component's props including title, transaction data, selection state, side designation (Left/Right), and metadata for currency detection. Describe the column configuration system that supports visibility toggling for fields like SN, Date, Description, Amount, Reference, Dr/Cr, and Aging. Explain the sorting functionality that allows ascending/descending sorts on sortable columns with visual indicators and the column-specific filtering interface. Cover the comprehensive search capability that filters across all transaction fields simultaneously. Detail the currency handling system that extracts currency codes from metadata (e.g., 'GENERAL LEDGER NAME') and applies appropriate symbols using the CURRENCY_SYMBOLS mapping. Explain the getDisplayAmount function that interprets DR/CR status from the recon field to determine proper sign display (negative for DR, positive for CR). Document the memoized data processing that combines filtering, sorting, and selection ordering for optimal performance. Describe the UI implementation including sticky headers, responsive design, and visual feedback for selected rows. Address common issues such as handling large datasets, maintaining sort/filter state during parent updates, and debugging display inconsistencies. Provide performance optimization tips including virtualization for large datasets and efficient memoization strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AuditService component that provides immutable audit logging with cryptographic chain verification in the analyzer-web application. Thoroughly explain implementation details of the createAuditLog method, which calculates SHA-256 hashes incorporating the previous log's hash to create a tamper-evident chain. Document the invocation relationship from various system actions and how it integrates with UI components like AuditLogModal and SnapshotHistoryModal. Detail the domain model including AuditLog, CreateAuditLogInput, and AuditLogFilter, and explain how beforeState and afterState are stored as JSON strings. Explain security-critical features like the verifyAuditChain method that detects tampering by recalculating hashes and comparing them with stored values. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how cryptographic chaining prevents unauthorized modifications and how user activity summaries are generated. Address common issues like handling high-frequency audit events, managing storage growth, and ensuring timestamp consistency across distributed systems. Provide performance optimization tips for indexing audit logs by userId, entityType, and timestamp, and discuss retention policies and archival strategies for compliance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Matching Logic
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the transaction matching logic handled by MatchService.ts. Explain the implementation of 1-to-1, 1-to-many, and many-to-many matching algorithms used to reconcile internal and external transactions. Document how MatchControls captures user selections from the dual-pane interface and invokes MatchService with transaction IDs and match rules. Describe the domain model for MatchGroup entities, including status tracking (pending, matched, approved) and audit trail generation. Include examples from TRANSACTION_IMPORT_GUIDE.md on future enhancement plans for matching logic. Address common issues such as partial matches, duplicate detection, and reconciliation balance validation. Provide guidance on extending the matching engine with custom business rules and integrating with the database for persistence. Discuss performance considerations when processing large match sets and strategies for asynchronous processing.

wiki_catalogs.name: MatchGroup Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the MatchGroup entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including id, timestamp, transaction relationships, leftTransactionIds and rightTransactionIds stored as JSON arrays, calculated totals (totalLeft, totalRight, difference), adjustment, comment, status, user tracking fields (matchByUserId, approvedById, approvedAt), version for optimistic locking, and timestamps. Explain how MatchGroup represents a reconciliation between internal and external transactions, with transactions linked through the matchId field on the Transaction model. Document the one-to-many relationship with Transaction and the two one-to-one relationships with User (for matchByUser and approvedBy). Include information about indexes on status and timestamp for query performance, and matchByUserId and approvedById for user-based filtering. Reference the matching workflow in MatchControls.tsx, explaining how matches are created, approved, and adjusted. Provide examples of common queries such as finding pending approvals or retrieving all matches for a specific user.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Import API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the transaction import endpoint at /api/transactions/import. Document the POST method accepting multipart/form-data with required fields: file (Excel workbook), sheetName (target worksheet), and mappingId (column configuration). Specify request headers including content-type and authorization bearer token. Detail the processing pipeline: file upload validation, Excel parsing using xlsx library, data transformation via excel-import.ts, and database persistence through Prisma. Define response schemas: 201 Created with import statistics (totalRows, successfulImports, errors) on success, 400 Bad Request with specific validation messages for invalid file types or missing parameters, and 500 Internal Server Error for processing failures. Include examples of importing a sample transactions.xlsx file using both fetch and axios, showing proper FormData construction. Address error handling strategies for malformed Excel files, duplicate transaction detection, and partial import scenarios. Highlight performance considerations such as memory usage for large files and recommended maximum file sizes. Reference integration points with TransactionImporter and TransactionImportWorkspace components for frontend usage patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Folder Synchronization API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the /api/sync/folders GET endpoint that enables directory listing of Excel files for batch processing. Document the required 'path' query parameter, authentication via NextAuth.js session, and security validations including absolute path checking and directory existence verification using fs.stat. Explain the response structure containing success status, folderPath, totalFiles count, and files array with name, path, size, and modified timestamp. Detail the file filtering logic that includes only .xlsx and .xls extensions and the Promise.all pattern for gathering file statistics. Include error responses for 400 (missing path, non-absolute path, not a directory), 401 (unauthorized), and 500 (server errors during directory read). Provide practical examples of client requests with encoded folder paths and demonstrate use cases for bulk import workflows. Address performance considerations for large directories and security implications of server-side file system access.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend layer of the analyzer-web application. Describe the high-level design based on React components within the Next.js App Router structure, emphasizing modular composition and state management patterns. Document the component hierarchy starting from ReconcileProApp as the main orchestrator that integrates FileSheetSelector, DualPaneTransactionView, MatchControls, and HistoryPanel. Explain data flow through props and context, particularly how transaction data is passed from TransactionImportWorkspace to TransactionTable for display. Detail the UI architecture including responsive layout in layout.tsx, page routing in app/page.tsx, and dynamic form handling in TransactionImporter. Include implementation specifics such as how DualPaneTransactionView enables side-by-side comparison of internal vs external transactions, and how MatchControls facilitates 1:1 and many-to-many matching logic. Provide practical examples from the codebase showing event handling, state updates, and interaction with backend APIs. Address common issues like component re-rendering performance and accessibility compliance. Include performance optimization tips such as memoization of transaction tables and lazy loading of reconciliation panels.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Layout and Routing Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the UI layout and routing structure of the analyzer-web application based on Next.js App Router conventions. Explain the role of layout.tsx in providing the root layout with global styles (globals.css), providers (providers.tsx), and consistent UI elements across all pages. Document the page.tsx implementation as the main application route that renders the ReconcileProApp component within the layout structure. Describe the responsive design approach using Tailwind CSS for consistent spacing, typography, and component alignment. Explain the integration of global providers such as authentication and theme providers that wrap the entire application. Cover the routing mechanism that determines which view mode (workspace, admin, import, sync) to display based on user permissions and navigation state. Detail the relationship between the layout components and the main application component, including how global styles are applied and how context providers enable state sharing. Address common issues such as hydration mismatches between server and client rendering, proper loading state management, and SEO considerations. Provide guidance on extending the layout structure with additional routes or layout variations while maintaining design consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Base Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the BaseService component that provides foundational functionality shared across all service classes in the analyzer-web application. Thoroughly explain implementation details of the executeInTransaction method, which wraps Prisma operations in database transactions to ensure atomicity and consistency across multiple model updates. Document the invocation relationship where UserService, MatchService, and AuditService extend BaseService to inherit transaction management and error handling capabilities. Explain the handleError method that standardizes error logging and propagation with context-aware messages. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how createMatch in MatchService uses executeInTransaction to atomically create match groups and update transaction statuses, and how createUser in UserService relies on the inherited error handling. Address common issues like transaction timeout configuration, proper error type checking, and avoiding memory leaks in long-running transactions. Provide best practices for extending BaseService with new services, maintaining consistent error formats, and monitoring transaction performance across high-concurrency scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: AuditLog Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the AuditLog entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including id, timestamp, user and session tracking (userId, sessionId), network information (ipAddress, deviceFingerprint, geolocation), action details (actionType, entityType, entityId), change tracking (beforeState, afterState, changeSummary, justification), and tamper detection fields (previousHash, currentHash). Explain how the cryptographic hash chain ensures audit trail integrity and enables tamper detection. Document the many-to-one relationship with User and the purpose of each actionType (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE, APPROVE, IMPORT, EXPORT, LOGIN, LOGOUT, MATCH, UNMATCH) and entityType (TRANSACTION, MATCH, USER, ROLE, PERIOD, SNAPSHOT, FILE_IMPORT). Include information about indexes on timestamp, userId, actionType, entityType, and entityId for query performance. Reference the implementation in AuditService.ts and AuditLogModal.tsx, explaining how audit logs are created, stored, and displayed. Provide examples of common queries such as retrieving all actions by a user or finding all transaction modifications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Sheets API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the transaction sheets endpoint at /api/transactions/sheets. Document the GET method that accepts a file parameter (presigned S3 URL or temporary upload ID) and returns a list of available worksheet names within the Excel workbook. Specify query parameters and authentication requirements using validateRequest with ANALYST or higher permissions. Detail the response format: 200 OK with JSON array of sheet names, 400 Bad Request for invalid file references, and 404 Not Found if the file doesn't exist. Explain the implementation using xlsx library's read operations in streaming mode to minimize memory usage. Provide usage examples showing how FileSheetSelector component calls this endpoint to populate the sheet selection dropdown during import workflows. Address performance considerations for large Excel files with many worksheets and security aspects like validating file sources and preventing directory traversal attacks. Include troubleshooting guidance for common issues such as empty sheet lists and parsing errors on corrupted files.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Sheets API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the /api/transactions/sheets endpoint that retrieves imported transaction sheets with hierarchical data. Document the three operational modes based on query parameters: (1) When sheetId is provided, return detailed sheet data with transactions categorized into glTransactions (intCr, intDr) and statementTransactions (extDr, extCr), including metadata parsing from JSON string; (2) When fileImportId is provided, list all sheets within that import with summary counts; (3) When no parameters, return all file imports with their associated sheets in descending upload order. Explain the authentication requirement via NextAuth.js, Prisma queries with include statements for related data, and response structure with success flag and nested data. Detail the transaction filtering to exclude soft-deleted records (isDeleted=false) and ordering by date. Include error handling for 404 (sheet not found) and 500 (database errors). Provide client usage examples for each use case and explain the integration with the frontend reconciliation interface for loading transaction data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the backend layer of the analyzer-web application. Describe the high-level design using Next.js API routes under the App Router, focusing on RESTful endpoint organization and request handling patterns. Document the architectural patterns employed: middleware.ts for authentication checks, api-security.ts for rate limiting and input validation, and route handlers for CRUD operations. Explain the integration between API routes and business logic services via the services/ directory. Detail specific implementations such as how /api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts integrates with NextAuth.js for OAuth and credentials-based login, how /api/admin/users/route.ts enforces role-based access control, and how /api/transactions/import/route.ts processes multipart form data for Excel uploads. Include system boundaries, data flows from HTTP requests to service layer to Prisma client, and error handling strategies. Address cross-cutting concerns like security (JWT tokens, bcrypt password hashing), monitoring (audit logging), and scalability (stateless API design). Provide infrastructure requirements, deployment topology considerations, and technology stack dependencies. Include examples of client implementation guidelines and performance optimization techniques such as request batching and response caching.

wiki_catalogs.name: SystemSnapshot Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the SystemSnapshot entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including id, timestamp, label, type (IMPORT, MANUAL, AUTO), snapshot data (transactions, matches stored as JSON), context (selectedDate), statistics (stats stored as JSON), and user tracking (createdByUserId). Explain how snapshots capture the state of transactions and matches at a specific point in time for versioning and recovery purposes. Document the many-to-one relationship with User and the purpose of each snapshot type. Include information about indexes on timestamp and createdByUserId for query performance. Reference the snapshot functionality in SnapshotHistoryModal.tsx, explaining how snapshots are created manually or automatically and how users can browse historical states. Provide examples of common queries such as retrieving the latest snapshot or finding all snapshots created by a specific user.

wiki_catalogs.name: Synchronization API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the synchronization API endpoints including /api/sync/folders and /api/sync/execute. For /api/sync/folders, document GET (retrieve configured sync folders), POST (create new folder mapping), and PATCH (update existing configuration) methods with their respective request/response schemas. For /api/sync/execute, detail the POST method that triggers immediate synchronization jobs and returns job status. Specify authentication requirements using api-security.ts middleware with MANAGER or ADMIN permissions. Define response formats: 200 OK for successful queries, 202 Accepted for job initiation, and appropriate error codes for validation failures or execution errors. Include examples of configuring a new Google Drive folder sync and triggering manual execution. Explain the integration with FolderSyncManager component for UI interactions. Address security considerations such as validating external storage credentials and preventing unauthorized folder access. Provide performance optimization tips like scheduling syncs during off-peak hours and monitoring job queue lengths. Reference error handling strategies for network timeouts and storage API rate limits.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the analyzer-web application's database schema. Detail all 9 core entities defined in schema.prisma: User, Transaction, MatchGroup, AuditLog, SystemSnapshot, DeviceSession, ExcelColumnMapping, FolderSyncConfig, and RolePermission. Explain entity relationships including foreign key constraints, one-to-many and many-to-many associations, and referential integrity rules. Document field definitions, data types, default values, and constraints (e.g., unique email in User, non-nullable timestamps). Include database schema diagrams showing tables and relationships, and provide sample data records for each entity. Explain data validation rules enforced at both Prisma and application levels, and business rules such as soft-delete behavior with deletedAt fields. Describe data access patterns used in services, caching strategies (if any), and performance considerations like index usage on frequently queried fields (e.g., userId, transactionDate). Specify data lifecycle management including retention policies for audit logs and archival rules for old snapshots. Include data migration paths from existing systems, version management via Prisma migrations, and data security measures like encryption at rest and access control. Reference DATABASE_PERSISTENCE.md for implementation details.

wiki_catalogs.name: DeviceSession Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the DeviceSession entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including id, userId, device information (device, ip, location), session tracking (lastActive, isCurrent), session token (token, expiresAt), and createdAt timestamp. Explain how device sessions enable multi-device tracking, session management, and security monitoring. Document the many-to-one relationship with User and the purpose of the isCurrent flag to identify the user's active session. Include information about indexes on userId, lastActive, and token for query performance. Reference the implementation notes in IMPLEMENTATION_COMPLETE.md, explaining how device sessions support features like active session management and security audits. Provide examples of common queries such as finding all active sessions for a user or identifying sessions by IP address.

wiki_catalogs.name: Service Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the service layer of the analyzer-web application. Describe the high-level design following the Service Layer Pattern, where business logic is encapsulated in reusable classes that mediate between API routes and data access via Prisma. Document the component interactions: how API endpoints import specific services (e.g., UserService for user management), how BaseService provides common functionality like error handling and logging, and how services coordinate transactions across multiple models. Explain technical decisions behind separating concerns into UserService (user CRUD, password reset, role management), MatchService (transaction matching algorithms), and AuditService (immutable log creation with cryptographic chaining). Include system boundaries, data flows from service methods to Prisma client, and integration patterns with external systems. Address cross-cutting concerns like security (input sanitization, permission checks), monitoring (audit event generation), and disaster recovery (data consistency). Provide infrastructure requirements, scalability considerations for concurrent reconciliation sessions, and deployment topology implications. Include technology stack dependencies, third-party integrations, and version compatibility notes. Use concrete examples from the codebase showing how createMatchGroup in MatchService interacts with Transaction and MatchGroup models.

wiki_catalogs.name: RolePermission Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the RolePermission entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including id, userId, requestedRole, reason, status, and review tracking (reviewedById, reviewedAt, reviewNotes). Explain how role requests facilitate the role management workflow, allowing users to request elevated permissions that require administrative approval. Document the many-to-one relationships with User (for both requester and reviewer) and the purpose of each status (PENDING, APPROVED, REJECTED). Include information about indexes on status, timestamp, and userId for query performance. Reference the implementation in AdminDashboard.tsx, explaining how role requests are displayed, reviewed, and processed. Provide examples of common queries such as finding all pending requests or retrieving the role request history for a specific user.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication and Authorization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the authentication and authorization system in analyzer-web. Explain the implementation using NextAuth.js with credentials provider, JWT-based session management, and database-backed user storage via Prisma adapter. Detail the login flow from /login/page.tsx to authentication handler, including credential validation, bcrypt password hashing, and session token generation. Document role-based access control with four roles (Admin, Manager, Analyst, Auditor) and their permissions as defined in types.ts and enforced in UserService and middleware. Describe advanced security features: failed login attempt tracking (5 attempts = 15-minute lockout), device session tracking with IP and fingerprinting, automatic audit logging of login/logout events, and progressive account locking. Include practical examples such as how AdminDashboard restricts access to user management functions. Address common issues like session expiration, token refresh mechanisms, and production deployment considerations from PRODUCTION_AUTH_FIX.md. Provide performance optimization tips including efficient session lookups and secure cookie configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: FileImport Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the FileImport entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including id, filename, mimeType, fileSize, storagePath, checksum (SHA-256 hash), processing status and counts, sheet counts, user tracking (uploadedById), relationships (transactions, sheets), and timestamps. Explain how FileImport represents an uploaded Excel workbook and serves as the parent container for SheetImport records. Document the one-to-many relationships with Transaction and SheetImport, and the many-to-one relationship with User. Include information about indexes on status, uploadedAt, uploadedById, and checksum for query performance, particularly for duplicate detection. Reference the implementation in DATABASE_PERSISTENCE.md and TRANSACTION_IMPORT_GUIDE.md, explaining how file imports enable duplicate prevention, import history, and efficient retrieval of transaction data. Provide examples of common queries such as finding all imports by a user or identifying duplicate files by checksum.

wiki_catalogs.name: Transaction Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on transaction management in the analyzer-web application. Explain the end-to-end workflow: uploading Excel files via TransactionImportWorkspace, parsing with xlsx library in excel-import.ts, mapping columns via ExcelColumnMapping model, and storing transactions in the database through /api/transactions/import. Detail the dual-pane reconciliation interface in DualPaneTransactionView that allows side-by-side comparison of internal and external transactions. Document matching capabilities including 1-to-1, 1-to-many, and many-to-many matching logic handled by MatchService. Include usage patterns such as filtering, searching, and bulk operations on transaction sets. Provide practical examples from the codebase showing how imported data is transformed and validated before persistence. Address common issues like malformed Excel files, date format inconsistencies, and large file handling. Include performance considerations such as virtualized rendering of large transaction tables and memory-efficient streaming of Excel data. Reference TRANSACTION_IMPORT_GUIDE.md for detailed import specifications.

wiki_catalogs.name: SheetImport Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the SheetImport entity in the analyzer-web application. Detail all fields including id, name, fileImportId, metadata (stored as JSON with DEPT, BRANCH, REPORTING DATE, etc.), transaction counts by type, reportingDate, sheetOrder, and createdAt timestamp. Explain how SheetImport represents a single worksheet within an Excel workbook that contains financial transactions, with metadata extracted during the import process. Document the many-to-one relationship with FileImport and the one-to-many relationship with Transaction. Include information about indexes on fileImportId and reportingDate for query performance. Reference the implementation in DATABASE_PERSISTENCE.md, explaining how sheet imports enable multi-sheet support, metadata preservation, and efficient retrieval of transactions by sheet. Provide examples of common queries such as retrieving all sheets from a specific file import or finding sheets by reporting date.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit and Compliance
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the audit and compliance features of analyzer-web. Explain the implementation of immutable audit logging using AuditService with cryptographic hash chaining to prevent tampering. Detail how every critical operation (login, logout, transaction match, user update) generates an audit event stored in the AuditLog table with timestamp, user ID, action type, and previous/next state hashes. Describe the tamper detection mechanism that verifies the integrity of the audit chain by recalculating hashes. Document the user interface in AuditLogModal for viewing chronological audit records with filtering and search capabilities. Include business rules such as write-once logs, restricted deletion policies, and session tracking via DeviceSession. Provide practical examples from the codebase showing how UserService.create logs user creation events or how MatchService.updateMatchGroup triggers audit entries. Address common issues like log rotation, storage scalability, and performance impact of synchronous logging. Include compliance considerations for financial regulations and best practices for audit trail retention.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the public endpoints of the analyzer-web application. For each RESTful API group, document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, authentication requirements, and error codes. Start with /api/auth/[...nextauth] for authentication (POST for login/logout, GET for session), detailing JWT token handling and CSRF protection. Document /api/admin/users for user management (GET all users, POST create, PATCH update, DELETE deactivate) with role-based access control. Cover /api/transactions/import for Excel file uploads (POST with multipart/form-data, expected fields: file, sheetName, mappingId), including response formats for success (201 Created with import stats) and failure (400 Bad Request with validation errors). Describe /api/transactions/sheets for retrieving available Excel sheets (GET with file preview). Include /api/sync/folders for folder synchronization configuration (GET list, POST create, PATCH update) and /api/sync/execute for triggering sync jobs. Provide protocol-specific examples using fetch or axios, error handling strategies for network failures and validation errors, security considerations (rate limiting, input sanitization), and versioning information. Address common use cases like automating imports via scripts, client implementation guidelines for frontend components, and performance optimization tips such as batching requests. Reference api-security.ts for middleware protections and include debugging tools like response logging and status monitoring.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment and Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on deploying and operating the analyzer-web application in production environments. Document the containerized architecture using Dockerfile.dev for image creation and docker-compose.yml for multi-container orchestration (app, database, optional reverse proxy). Provide step-by-step deployment instructions including environment variable configuration, volume mounting for persistent database storage, and network setup. Include production-specific considerations from PRODUCTION_DEPLOYMENT_CHECKLIST.md such as SSL termination, backup strategies, monitoring setup, and security hardening. Address operational tasks like database migrations in production (npx prisma migrate deploy), log rotation, and performance monitoring. Cover troubleshooting guidance from PRODUCTION_TROUBLESHOOTING.md including diagnosing authentication failures, database connection issues, and API timeout errors. Provide scaling recommendations for handling increased transaction volumes and user concurrency. Include rollback procedures, disaster recovery plans, and maintenance windows for updates. Make content accessible to DevOps engineers while providing sufficient technical depth on infrastructure requirements and cloud deployment patterns.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Overview: Analyzer Web

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The **Analyzer Web** application is a financial reconciliation platform designed to streamline transaction matching, auditing, and reporting workflows. It enables users to import Excel-based financial data, reconcile internal ledger entries with external bank statements, and maintain a secure, auditable record of all reconciliation activities.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Enable seamless import of Excel files containing transaction data
- Facilitate dual-pane reconciliation (internal vs. external transactions)
- Implement role-based access control and separation of duties
- Provide comprehensive audit logging with tamper detection
- Support snapshot versioning and historical tracking
- Ensure secure authentication with login attempt throttling and account lockout

### Target Audience
- **Financial Analysts**: Perform daily reconciliation tasks
- **Managers**: Approve matches and oversee team activity
- **Auditors**: Review transaction history and compliance
- **Administrators**: Manage users, roles, and system configuration

---

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The application follows a **Next.js 14**-based full-stack architecture using the App Router, with:
- **Frontend**: React components with TypeScript
- **Backend**: API routes within the `app/api` directory
- **Database**: SQLite via Prisma ORM
- **Authentication**: NextAuth.js with credential-based login
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with Recharts for visualizations

### Design Patterns
- **Service Layer Pattern**: Business logic encapsulated in `services/` classes
- **Repository Pattern**: Data access via Prisma client
- **JWT-based Session Management**: Secure authentication flow
- **Modular Component Architecture**: UI broken into reusable components
- **Event-Driven Auditing**: Actions trigger audit log entries

### System Relationships and Data Flow

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Browser] --> B[Next.js App Router]
    B --> C[API Routes]
    C --> D[Service Layer]
    D --> E[Prisma ORM]
    E --> F[(SQLite Database)]
    D --> G[Audit Logging]
    G --> F
    H[Excel Upload] --> C
    C --> I[Transaction Processing]
    I --> F
    J[User Actions] --> G
```

---

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **App Root**: `app/page.tsx` â€“ Renders the main reconciliation interface
- **Authentication**: `app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts` â€“ Handles login/logout
- **API Endpoints**: All routes under `app/api/` for data operations

### Core Modules
- **ReconcileProApp**: `components/ReconcileProApp.tsx` â€“ Main workspace orchestrator
- **UserService**: `services/UserService.ts` â€“ User management and security
- **AuditService**: `services/AuditService.ts` â€“ Immutable audit logging
- **Prisma Client**: `lib/prisma.ts` â€“ Database access layer
- **Authentication**: `lib/auth.ts` â€“ NextAuth configuration

### Configuration Approach
- **Environment Validation**: `lib/env-validation.ts`
- **Constants**: `lib/constants.ts` â€“ Configurable values (e.g., login attempts)
- **Next.js Config**: `next.config.mjs` â€“ Framework settings
- **Tailwind CSS**: `tailwind.config.ts` â€“ Styling configuration
- **Prisma Schema**: `prisma/schema.prisma` â€“ Database structure

### External Dependencies
- **Next.js 14**: React framework
- **Prisma ORM**: Database modeling and access
- **NextAuth.js**: Authentication
- **xlsx**: Excel file parsing
- **recharts**: Data visualization
- **bcryptjs**: Password hashing

### Integration Points
- **Excel Import**: `/api/transactions/import` â€“ Upload and parse Excel files
- **Transaction Retrieval**: `/api/transactions/sheets` â€“ Load imported data
- **Folder Sync**: `/api/sync/folders` â€“ External folder monitoring
- **User Management**: `/api/admin/users` â€“ Admin user operations

### Component Relationship Diagram

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[ReconcileProApp] --> B[FileSheetSelector]
    A --> C[DualPaneTransactionView]
    A --> D[MatchControls]
    A --> E[HistoryPanel]
    B --> F[Transaction Import API]
    C --> G[TransactionTable]
    D --> H[MatchService]
    A --> I[AuditService]
    A --> J[UserService]
    K[AuthProvider] --> A
    L[PrismaClient] --> J
    L --> I
    M[NextAuth] --> K
```

---

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
- **Excel Import**: Upload and parse multi-sheet financial reports
- **Dual-Pane Reconciliation**: Match internal and external transactions
- **Role-Based Access Control**: Admin, Manager, Analyst, Auditor roles
- **Audit Trail**: Immutable logs with cryptographic chain verification
- **Snapshot Versioning**: Save and restore reconciliation states
- **Approval Workflows**: Role-based approval thresholds
- **Session Management**: Track active logins and device fingerprints

### Implementation Highlights
- **Auto-Loading Sheets**: Selecting a sheet automatically loads its data
- **Separation of Duties**: Importers cannot approve their own matches
- **Tamper-Evident Audit Logs**: SHA-256 chained hashing prevents modification
- **Dynamic UI Updates**: Real-time updates without page reloads
- **File & Sheet Selection**: Dropdowns for navigating imported data

### Feature Architecture: Transaction Import & Reconciliation

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> FileUploaded: Upload Excel
    FileUploaded --> Processing: Parse Sheets
    Processing --> Stored: Save to DB
    Stored --> Selection: Show in UI
    Selection --> SheetSelected: User selects sheet
    SheetSelected --> DataLoaded: Auto-load transactions
    DataLoaded --> Reconciliation: Dual-pane view
    Reconciliation --> Matched: Create match
    Matched --> Approved: Manager approval
    Approved --> Finalized: Adjustment applied
    Finalized --> Snapshot: Save state
    Snapshot --> Idle: Continue working
```

### Feature Architecture: Audit Logging

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    User->>+Frontend: Perform action (e.g., match transaction)
    Frontend->>+API: Send request
    API->>+Service: Process business logic
    Service->>+AuditService: Log action
    AuditService->>+Database: Store with previous hash
    Database-->>-AuditService: Confirmation
    AuditService-->>-Service: Continue
    Service-->>-API: Complete operation
    API-->>-Frontend: Response
    Frontend-->>-User: Update UI
```

### Data Model Overview

```mermaid
erDiagram
    USER ||--o{ TRANSACTION : imports
    USER ||--o{ MATCH_GROUP : creates
    USER ||--o{ AUDIT_LOG : generates
    USER ||--o{ DEVICE_SESSION : maintains
    FILE_IMPORT ||--o{ SHEET_IMPORT : contains
    SHEET_IMPORT ||--o{ TRANSACTION : contains
    MATCH_GROUP ||--o{ TRANSACTION : groups
    AUDIT_LOG ||--|| MATCH_GROUP : references
    SYSTEM_SNAPSHOT ||--o{ MATCH_GROUP : captures
    ROLE_REQUEST ||--|| USER : requests
```

Sources:
- [package.json](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\package.json)
- [next.config.mjs](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\next.config.mjs)
- [schema.prisma](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\prisma\schema.prisma)
- [page.tsx](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\app\page.tsx)
- [auth.ts](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\lib\auth.ts)
- [UserService.ts](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\services\UserService.ts)
- [AuditService.ts](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\services\AuditService.ts)
- [prisma.ts](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\lib\prisma.ts)
- [types.ts](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\lib\types.ts)
- [RECONCILE_APP_INTEGRATION.md](c:\mani\ise\projects\Arbutus\apps\analyzer-web\docs\RECONCILE_APP_INTEGRATION.md)
</blog>
